name: Water Marigold

Identifying Characteristics: Stems: robust, up to 7m long, usually 8-10cm above water
Leaves: two types: submersed – widely branch divided, oppositely arranged, no petiole; emergent – lance-shaped, serrations, oppositely arranged, no petiole
Flowers: midsummer, showy yellow daisy-like (2-2.5cm wide) with (usually) 8 petals, among emergent leaves
Fruits/Seeds: late summer, dark brown achene narrow ( up to 12mm long), round to oval in cross-section, 3-6 needle-like bristles at base
Biology: Reproduction by seed is rare in northeast
Habitat: Soft substrates of lakes and streams
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, much of northern United States

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
